Class Greep

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      Greep

public abstract class Greep
extends greenfoot.Actor

A Greep is the base class for all alien beings in this scenario. It provides the basic abilities of greeps in this world.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Michael Kolling, Davin McCall, Poul Henriksen

          Create a greep.

Constructor Detail

Greep

public Greep(Ship ship)
Create a greep.

Method Detail

act

public void act()
Greenfoot's standard act method, which can be reimplemented in subclasses. When reimplemented, the first line of the act() should always call super.act().

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

atShip

protected final boolean atShip()
True if we are at our space ship.

atWater

protected final boolean atWater()
Return true if we have just seen water in front of us. The edge of the map is also water.

block

protected final void block()
Block opponent greeps from passing our current location. This is only effective if we haven't moved (can't move and block in the same turn).

carryingTomato

protected final boolean carryingTomato()
Check whether we are carrying a tomato.

dropTomato

protected final void dropTomato()
Drop the tomato we are carrying. If we are at the ship, it is counted. If not, it's just gone...

getFlag

public final boolean getFlag(int flagNo)
Retrieve the value of a flag. 'flagNo' can be 1 or 2. Other friendly greeps are allowed to call this mehtod.

getFriend

protected final Greep getFriend()
Returns a friendly greep, if there is one at our current location. Returns null otherwise.

You are only allowed to access the memory and flags of the friend.

getMemory

public final int getMemory(int slot)
Retrieve a previously stored value. Other friendly greeps are allowed to call this mehtod.

getName

public abstract java.lang.String getName()
This method specifies the name of the greeps (for display on the result board). Try to keep the name short so that it displays nicely on the result board.

getShipData

protected final int[] getShipData()
Get the ship's data bank array (1000 ints). This can only be done if the greep is at the ship. The data inside the array can be freely manipulated.

getTomatoes

protected final TomatoPile getTomatoes()
If we can see tomatoes, this will return them. Otherwise it returnes null.

You are only allowed to call getX() and getY() on the returned tomato pile.

isBlocking

protected final boolean isBlocking()
Return true if this greep is in "blocking" mode - it has hunkered down to prevent opponent greeps from passing (while allowing friendly greeps through).

kablam

protected final void kablam()
Release a stink bomb. All greeps within a small radius will be knocked out for a small period of time. If a greep carrying a tomato is knocked out, it will drop the tomato on the ground.

loadTomato

protected final void loadTomato()
Load a tomato onto *another* greep. This works only if there is another greep and a tomato pile present, otherwise this method does nothing.

move

protected final void move()
Try and move forward in the current direction. If we are blocked (by water, or an opponent greep who is blocking), we won't move; atWater()/moveWasBlocked() can be used to check for this, and in that case, it is allowed to change direction and try move()ing again.

moveWasBlocked

protected final boolean moveWasBlocked()
Return true if we have been blocked by an opponent greep.

numberOfFriends

protected final int numberOfFriends(boolean withTomatoes)
Return the number of nearby friendly greeps which are not currently knocked out by a stink bomb.

Parameters:
withTomatoes - If true, only count the greeps that are carrying a tomato.

numberOfOpponents

protected final int numberOfOpponents(boolean withTomatoes)
Return the number of nearby opponent greeps which are not currently knocked out by a stink bomb.

Parameters:
withTomatoes - If true, only count the greeps that are carrying a tomato.

randomChance

protected final boolean randomChance(int percent)
Return 'true' in exactly 'percent' number of calls. That is: a call randomChance(25) has a 25% chance to return true.

setFlag

protected final void setFlag(int flagNo,
                             boolean val)
Store a user defined boolean value (a "flag"). Two flags are available, i.e. 'flagNo' may be 1 or 2.

setMemory

protected final void setMemory(int slot,
                               int val)
Store something in the greep's memory. There are four memory slots, numbered 0 to 3, each can hold an int value.

turn

public final void turn(int angle)
Turn 'angle' degrees towards the right (clockwise).

Overrides:
turn in class greenfoot.Actor

turnHome

protected final void turnHome()
Turn in the direction facing the home ship.

turnTowards

public final void turnTowards(int x,
                              int y)
Turn to face an arbitrary point on the map.

Overrides:
turnTowards in class greenfoot.Actor
